verses.verse: Then <S%G2532><s%> came <S%G4863><s%> together <S%G4863><s%> to him the Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> and certain <S%G5100><s%> of the scribes, <S%G1122><s%> which came <S%G2064><s%> from Jerusalem. <S%G2414><s%>

And when they saw <S%G1492><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of his disciples <S%G3101><s%> eat <S%G2068><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> with defiled, <S%G2839><s%> that is to say, <S%G3004><s%> with unwashed, <S%G449><s%> hands, <S%G5495><s%> they found fault. <S%G3201><s%>

For the Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> except <S%G3362><s%> they wash <S%G3538><s%> their hands <S%G5495><s%> oft, <S%G4435><s%> eat <S%G2068><s%> not, holding <S%G2902><s%> the tradition <S%G3862><s%> of the elders. <S%G4245><s%>

And when they come from the market, <S%G58><s%> except <S%G3362><s%> they wash, <S%G907><s%> they eat <S%G2068><s%> not. And many <S%G4183><s%> other <S%G243><s%> things there be, which <S%G3739><s%> they have received <S%G3880><s%> to hold, <S%G2902><s%> as the washing <S%G909><s%> of cups, <S%G4221><s%> and pots, <S%G3582><s%> brazen <S%G5473><s%> vessels, and of tables. <S%G2825><s%>

Then <S%G1899><s%> the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and scribes <S%G1122><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> him, Why <S%G1302><s%> walk <S%G4043><s%> not your disciples <S%G3101><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the tradition <S%G3862><s%> of the elders, <S%G4245><s%> but eat <S%G2068><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> with unwashed <S%G449><s%> hands? <S%G5495><s%>

He answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> to them, Well <S%G2573><s%> has Esaias <S%G2268><s%> prophesied <S%G4395><s%> of you hypocrites, <S%G5273><s%> as it is written, <S%G1125><s%> This <S%G3778><s%> people <S%G2992><s%> honors <S%G5091><s%> me with their lips, <S%G5491><s%> but their heart <S%G2588><s%> is far <S%G4206><s%> from me.
However, in vain <S%G3155><s%> do they worship <S%G4576><s%> me, teaching <S%G1321><s%> for doctrines <S%G1319><s%> the commandments <S%G1778><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>

For laying <S%G863><s%> aside <S%G863><s%> the commandment <S%G1785><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> you hold <S%G2902><s%> the tradition <S%G3862><s%> of men, <S%G444><s%> as the washing <S%G909><s%> of pots <S%G3582><s%> and cups: <S%G4221><s%> and many <S%G4183><s%> other <S%G243><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> like <S%G3946><s%> things you do. <S%G4160><s%>

And he said <S%G3004><s%> to them, Full well <S%G2573><s%> you reject <S%G114><s%> the commandment <S%G1785><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> that you may keep <S%G5083><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> own tradition. <S%G3862><s%>

For Moses <S%G3475><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> Honor <S%G5091><s%> your father <S%G3962><s%> and your mother; <S%G3384><s%> and, Whoever <S%G3588><s%> curses <S%G2551><s%> father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> mother, <S%G3384><s%> let him die <S%G5053><s%> the death: <S%G2288><s%>

But you say, <S%G3004><s%> If <S%G1437><s%> a man <S%G444><s%> shall say <S%G2036><s%> to his father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> mother, <S%G3384><s%> It is Corban, <S%G2878><s%> that is to say, a gift, <S%G1435><s%> by whatever <S%G1437><s%> you might be profited <S%G5623><s%> by me; he shall be free.
And you suffer <S%G863><s%> him no <S%G3765><s%> more <S%G3765><s%> to do <S%G4160><s%> ought <S%G3762><s%> for his father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> his mother; <S%G3384><s%>

Making <S%G208><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> of none <S%G208><s%> effect <S%G208><s%> through your <S%G5216><s%> tradition, <S%G3862><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you have delivered: <S%G3860><s%> and many <S%G4183><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> like <S%G3946><s%> things do <S%G4160><s%> you.

And when he had called <S%G4341><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the people <S%G3793><s%> to him, he said <S%G3004><s%> to them, Listen <S%G191><s%> to me every <S%G3956><s%> one of you, and understand: <S%G4920><s%>

There is nothing <S%G3762><s%> from without <S%G1855><s%> a man, <S%G444><s%> that entering <S%G1531><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> him can <S%G1410><s%> defile <S%G2840><s%> him: but the things which come <S%G1607><s%> out of him, those <S%G1565><s%> are they that defile <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>
If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> man have <S%G2192><s%> ears <S%G3775><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> let him hear. <S%G191><s%>

And when <S%G3753><s%> he was entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the house <S%G3624><s%> from the people, <S%G3793><s%> his disciples <S%G3101><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> him concerning <S%G4012><s%> the parable. <S%G3850><s%>

And he said <S%G3004><s%> to them, Are you so <S%G3779><s%> without <S%G801><s%> understanding <S%G801><s%> also? <S%G2532><s%> Do you not perceive, <S%G3539><s%> that whatever <S%G3956><s%> thing from without <S%G1855><s%> enters <S%G1531><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the man, <S%G444><s%> it cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> defile <S%G2840><s%> him;

Because <S%G3754><s%> it enters <S%G1531><s%> not into <S%G1519><s%> his heart, <S%G2588><s%> but into <S%G1519><s%> the belly, <S%G2836><s%> and goes <S%G1607><s%> out into <S%G1519><s%> the draught, <S%G856><s%> purging <S%G2511><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> meats? <S%G1033><s%>
And he said, <S%G3004><s%> That which comes <S%G1607><s%> out of the man, <S%G444><s%> that defiles <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>

For from within, <S%G2081><s%> out of the heart <S%G2588><s%> of men, <S%G444><s%> proceed <S%G1607><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> thoughts, <S%G1261><s%> adulteries, <S%G3430><s%> fornications, <S%G4202><s%> murders, <S%G5408><s%>

Thefts, <S%G2829><s%> covetousness, <S%G4124><s%> wickedness, <S%G4189><s%> deceit, <S%G1388><s%> lasciviousness, <S%G766><s%> an evil <S%G4190><s%> eye, <S%G3788><s%> blasphemy, <S%G988><s%> pride, <S%G5243><s%> foolishness: <S%G877><s%>
All <S%G3956><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> evil <S%G4190><s%> things come <S%G1607><s%> from within, <S%G2081><s%> and defile <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>

And from there <S%G1564><s%> he arose, <S%G450><s%> and went <S%G565><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the borders <S%G3181><s%> of Tyre <S%G5184><s%> and Sidon, <S%G4605><s%> and entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> an house, <S%G3614><s%> and would <S%G2309><s%> have no <S%G3762><s%> man <S%G3762><s%> know <S%G1097><s%> it: but he could <S%G1410><s%> not be hid. <S%G2990><s%>

For a certain woman, <S%G1135><s%> whose <S%G3739><s%> young <S%G2365><s%> daughter <S%G2365><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> an unclean <S%G169><s%> spirit, <S%G4151><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of him, and came <S%G2064><s%> and fell <S%G4363><s%> at <S%G4314><s%> his feet: <S%G4228><s%>

The woman <S%G1135><s%> was a Greek, <S%G1674><s%> a Syrophenician <S%G4949><s%> by nation; <S%G1085><s%> and she sought <S%G2065><s%> him that he would cast <S%G1544><s%> forth <S%G1544><s%> the devil <S%G1140><s%> out of her daughter. <S%G2364><s%>

But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to her, Let <S%G863><s%> the children <S%G5043><s%> first <S%G4412><s%> be filled: <S%G5526><s%> for it is not meet <S%G2570><s%> to take <S%G2983><s%> the children's <S%G5043><s%> bread, <S%G740><s%> and to cast <S%G906><s%> it to the dogs. <S%G2952><s%>

And she answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to him, Yes, <S%G3483><s%> Lord: <S%G2962><s%> yet <S%G1063><s%> the dogs <S%G2952><s%> under <S%G5270><s%> the table <S%G5132><s%> eat <S%G2068><s%> of the children's <S%G3813><s%> crumbs. <S%G5589><s%>
And he said <S%G2036><s%> to her, For this <S%G5126><s%> saying <S%G3056><s%> go <S%G5217><s%> your way; the devil <S%G1140><s%> is gone <S%G1831><s%> out of your daughter. <S%G2364><s%>

And when she was come <S%G565><s%> to her house, <S%G3624><s%> she found <S%G2147><s%> the devil <S%G1140><s%> gone <S%G1831><s%> out, and her daughter <S%G2364><s%> laid <S%G906><s%> on the bed. <S%G2825><s%>

And again, <S%G3825><s%> departing <S%G1831><s%> from the coasts <S%G3725><s%> of Tyre <S%G5184><s%> and Sidon, <S%G4605><s%> he came <S%G2064><s%> to the sea <S%G2281><s%> of Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> through <S%G303><s%> the middle <S%G3319><s%> of the coasts <S%G3725><s%> of Decapolis. <S%G1179><s%>

And they bring <S%G5342><s%> to him one that was deaf, <S%G2974><s%> and had an impediment <S%G3424><s%> in his speech; <S%G3424><s%> and they beseech <S%G3870><s%> him to put <S%G2007><s%> his hand <S%G5495><s%> on him.

And he took <S%G618><s%> him aside <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2398><s%> from the multitude, <S%G3793><s%> and put <S%G906><s%> his fingers <S%G1147><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> his ears, <S%G3775><s%> and he spit, <S%G4429><s%> and touched <S%G680><s%> his tongue; <S%G1100><s%>
And looking <S%G308><s%> up to heaven, <S%G3772><s%> he sighed, <S%G4727><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to him, Ephphatha, <S%G2188><s%> that is, Be opened. <S%G1272><s%>

And straightway <S%G2112><s%> his ears <S%G189><s%> were opened, <S%G1272><s%> and the string <S%G1199><s%> of his tongue <S%G1100><s%> was loosed, <S%G3089><s%> and he spoke <S%G2980><s%> plain. <S%G3723><s%>

And he charged <S%G1291><s%> them that they should tell <S%G2036><s%> no <S%G3367><s%> man: <S%G3367><s%> but the more <S%G3745><s%> he charged <S%G1291><s%> them, so much <S%G3123><s%> the more <S%G3123><s%> a great <S%G3123><s%> deal <S%G4054><s%> they published <S%G2784><s%> it;

And were beyond <S%G5249><s%> measure <S%G5249><s%> astonished, <S%G1605><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> He has done <S%G4160><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> things well: <S%G2573><s%> he makes <S%G4160><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> the deaf <S%G2974><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> and the dumb <S%G216><s%> to speak. <S%G2980><s%>
